page.title: 08Farming Chaldon Hills
page.content: Agriculture is the major use of land, and the major source of employment in the area. Dairy, sheep and arable farming exist side-by-side. Dairy herds are mainly Friesan but Fields Farm has Friesan/Holstein cross, which are valuable prizewinning cattle. Sheep graze on the hillsides in large numbers. Although much of the rough pasture land remains, some has been reclaimed for the growing of cereals. With the shortage of manpower a large number of agricultural vehicles are used. Distances of fields from the farm are such that Citizens Band Radios are used for quick contact. Crops are sown in a four year rotation of winter wheat, barley, spring barley, grass, kale then re-seeding. Turnips and maize are also grown.
